intro: Sunipia paleacea, commonly known as the paleaceae sunipia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it remains relatively rare in horticultural trade.
